body_html: Yeah of course tensorflow serving itself is not the answer. My point is that the core of distributed training is how to pass tensors (activations/weights/gradients) efficiently between machines, which is half done with a proved decent network framework as gRPC.
body_text: Yeah of course tensorflow serving itself is not the answer. My point is that the core of distributed training is how to pass tensors (activations/weights/gradients) efficiently between machines, which is half done with a proved decent network framework as gRPC.
body: Yeah of course tensorflow serving itself is not the answer. My point is that the core of distributed training is how to pass tensors (activations/weights/gradients) efficiently between machines, which is half done with a proved decent network framework as gRPC.
